address-data: Zahraa El Maadi, El Nada Tower, First Floor.
faq-q1: Where is Dr. Kareem Zaher’s clinic located?
faq-a1: Our urology and andrology clinic is conveniently located in Zahraa El Maadi, Cairo, specifically in the 13th Sector at El Nada Tower (1st Floor). We serve patients from across Maadi, Cairo, and surrounding governates seeking specialized urinary and male reproductive care.
faq-q2: What is the best treatment for kidney stones?
faq-a2: The best treatment depends on the size and location of the stone. Dr. Kareem Zaher specializes in minimally invasive solutions, including Laser Lithotripsy and Endoscopic removal. These modern techniques allow for faster recovery and less pain compared to traditional open surgeries. We assess each case individually to recommend the safest path.
faq-q3: Do you treat Erectile Dysfunction (ED) and male infertility?
faq-a3: Yes. As a specialized Andrologist, Dr. Kareem provides comprehensive care for men's health issues. This includes the diagnosis and treatment of Erectile Dysfunction (ED), premature ejaculation, and Male Infertility (such as Varicocele surgery). We also offer advanced options like penile implants for severe cases.
faq-q4: What are the options for treating an enlarged prostate (BPH)?
faq-a4: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) is common in men as they age. We offer a range of treatments from medication management to endoscopic prostate surgery (TURP) and laser vaporization. Our goal is to improve urinary flow and quality of life with minimal side effects.
faq-q5: Do I need a referral to book an appointment?
faq-a5: No referral is necessary. You can book an appointment directly through our website or by calling our clinic in Maadi. We strive to offer flexible evening clinic hours (7:00 PM – 10:00 PM) to accommodate your work schedule.
sms: You Will Be Contacted By Our Reception Team.
et-p1: The 15-question International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) Questionnaire is a validated, multi dimensional, self-administered investigation that has been found useful in the clinical assessment of erectile dysfunction and treatment outcomes in clinical trials.
et-p2: A score of 0-5 is awarded to each of the 15 questions that examine the 4 main domains of male sexual function: erectile function, orgasmic function, sexual desire and intercourse satisfaction.
et-p4: IIEF assessment is limited by the superficial assessment of psychosexual background and the very limited assessment of partner relationship, both important factors in the presentation of male sexual dysfunction.
et-p5: Analysis of the questionnaire should, therefore, be viewed as an adjunct to, rather than a substitute for, a detailed sexual history and examination.
et-p8: The international index of erectile function (IIEF): a multidimensional scale for assessment of erectile dysfunction.
booking-confirmed: Your Booking will Be confirmed By Our Reception Team, or You Can Contact Us On Whatsapp.
